newsitem.title: INDIA: Another fire in Indian capital, no casualties.
newsitem.headline: Another fire in Indian capital, no casualties.

text.p: A big fire broke out in a multi-storey building in New Delhi's central business district on Tuesday but no casualties were immediately reported.
The fire came four days after a blaze at the city's Uphaar Grand movie hall killed 57 people.

The fire on Tuesday broke out on the ninth floor of the Chanderlok Building in the Connaught Place area and was spreading down the lift shaft, fire officials said. Fire control authorities were still trying to put the fire out.
Police and witnesses said no one was immediately reported trapped or injured.

The floor houses one of the offices of Mahanagar Telephone Nigam Ltd, which provides telephone services in Delhi and Bombay, the tourism offices of several northern Indian states and the office of Japan Air Lines.
